## General course information

## What you need

- Laptop
- Enthusiasm

## Book, etc.

- There is no one-size-fits-all statistics textbook. Any that we chose would be a compromise.
- No official textbook. Many recommendations on Canvas if you are looking for a book.

## Online lectures

- Available Mondays (or sooner)
- Watch, rewatch, take notes, look up things you don't understand, etc.

## Grading

Participation (50%): Your participation grade in the course will be a function of:

- Quiz questions (completion)
- Problem sets (completion)
- Peer evaluations (both your own completion of and others' evaluation of you)
- In class contributions

## Grading

Review Project (10%)

## Grading

Final Exam (40%)

- The final exam will be distributed at the beginning of May and will be due on 5/10.
- You can not work with other members of the class or anyone else on this exam. You will be able to use all other available resources (books, notes, lectures, internet, etc.).

## Quiz questions

- In between some of the lectures
    - e.g., Watch a lecture, answer some questions
- Not graded, but you do need to complete them.
